004
005package edu.wpi.first.math.controller;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.math.Matrix;
008import edu.wpi.first.math.Num;
009import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N1;
010import edu.wpi.first.math.system.LinearSystem;
011import org.ejml.simple.SimpleMatrix;
012
013/**
014 * Contains the controller coefficients and logic for an implicit model follower.
015 *
016 * <p>Implicit model following lets us design a feedback controller that erases the dynamics of our
017 * system and makes it behave like some other system. This can be used to make a drivetrain more
018 * controllable during teleop driving by making it behave like a slower or more benign drivetrain.
019 *
020 * <p>For more on the underlying math, read appendix B.3 in
021 * https://file.tavsys.net/control/controls-engineering-in-frc.pdf.
022 */
023@SuppressWarnings("ClassTypeParameterName")
024public class ImplicitModelFollower<States extends Num, Inputs extends Num, Outputs extends Num> {
025  // Computed controller output
026  @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
027  private Matrix<Inputs, N1> m_u;
028
029  // State space conversion gain
030  @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
031  private Matrix<Inputs, States> m_A;
032
033  // Input space conversion gain
034  @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
035  private Matrix<Inputs, Inputs> m_B;
036
037  /**
038   * Constructs a controller with the given coefficients and plant.
039   *
040   * @param plant The plant being controlled.
041   * @param plantRef The plant whose dynamics should be followed.
042   */
043  public ImplicitModelFollower(
044      LinearSystem<States, Inputs, Outputs> plant, LinearSystem<States, Inputs, Outputs> plantRef) {
045    this(plant.getA(), plant.getB(), plantRef.getA(), plantRef.getB());
046  }
047
048  /**
049   * Constructs a controller with the given coefficients and plant.
050   *
051   * @param A Continuous system matrix of the plant being controlled.
052   * @param B Continuous input matrix of the plant being controlled.
053   * @param Aref Continuous system matrix whose dynamics should be followed.
054   * @param Bref Continuous input matrix whose dynamics should be followed.
055   */
056  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
057  public ImplicitModelFollower(
058      Matrix<States, States> A,
059      Matrix<States, Inputs> B,
060      Matrix<States, States> Aref,
061      Matrix<States, Inputs> Bref) {
062    m_u = new Matrix<>(new SimpleMatrix(B.getNumCols(), 1));
063
064    // Find u_imf that makes real model match reference model.
065    //
066    // dx/dt = Ax + Bu_imf
067    // dz/dt = A_ref z + B_ref u
068    //
069    // Let x = z.
070    //
071    // dx/dt = dz/dt
072    // Ax + Bu_imf = Aref x + B_ref u
073    // Bu_imf = A_ref x - Ax + B_ref u
074    // Bu_imf = (A_ref - A)x + B_ref u
075    // u_imf = B⁻¹((A_ref - A)x + Bref u)
076    // u_imf = -B⁻¹(A - A_ref)x + B⁻¹B_ref u
077
078    // The first term makes the open-loop poles that of the reference
079    // system, and the second term makes the input behave like that of the
080    // reference system.
081    m_A = B.solve(A.minus(Aref)).times(-1.0);
082    m_B = B.solve(Bref);
083
084    reset();
085  }
086
087  /**
088   * Returns the control input vector u.
089   *
090   * @return The control input.
091   */
092  public Matrix<Inputs, N1> getU() {
093    return m_u;
094  }
095
096  /**
097   * Returns an element of the control input vector u.
098   *
099   * @param i Row of u.
100   * @return The row of the control input vector.
101   */
102  public double getU(int i) {
103    return m_u.get(i, 0);
104  }
105
106  /** Resets the controller. */
107  public void reset() {
108    m_u.fill(0.0);
109  }
110
111  /**
112   * Returns the next output of the controller.
113   *
114   * @param x The current state x.
115   * @param u The current input for the original model.
116   * @return The next controller output.
117   */
118  public Matrix<Inputs, N1> calculate(Matrix<States, N1> x, Matrix<Inputs, N1> u) {
119    m_u = m_A.times(x).plus(m_B.times(u));
120    return m_u;
121  }
122}
